Question: Her next play, The Drag, dealt with homosexuality and was what this person called one of her "comedy-dramas of life".
Hints: This person was born Mary Jane **** in Bushwick, Brooklyn, New York, delivered at home by an aunt who was a midwife.
This person continued to write plays, including The Wicked Age, Pleasure Man and The Constant Sinner.
In 1939, Universal Pictures approached this person to star in a film opposite W C.
